name: Cellulitis, Buccal
general_information: Buccal cellulitis is characterized by a woody induration of the soft tissues of the cheek or face, primarily affecting children under 5 years old. The incidence has significantly decreased due to the Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine.
presenting_symptoms: Marked cheek swelling with minimal trismus and potential systemic symptoms like fever.
diagnostic_tests: Diagnosis is primarily clinical, based on the characteristic presentation.
